author.name: Brother Arnulfus
author.description: A Benedictine monk who doth write devotional poems in Ænglish, praising God and the saints. His poems are often humorous, short, and satirical. They often contain metaphors of alcohol, especially wine or ale.

newsMedieval:
Upon an Oiler Russian, Ukraine cast her ire,
Its value, once resounding, did like a psalm retire.
The tavern's drink scarce different, when fraught with plight and fire,
Its worth is hushed, mid-April no more shall it inspire.

A confluence of metals, some low and others peak,
Like a barkeep's wares, their value, the meek and strong shall tweak.
Gold, noble as a saint's heart, did fall with outlook bleak,
Yet like a sturdy cellar, constrained supply doth speak.

The dollar, like dry cider that's been left out in the sun, 
On Friday fell, but now finds strength, its losses all but won. 
Yet, like a merry drunkard, its glee may come undone, 
If Thursday's data tells us inflations' race is run.

feedItems.title: Oil Muted After Ukraine Attacks Russian Oil Tanker
feedItems.description: Oil prices hovered close to their highest level since mid-April as investors weighed the impact of a Ukrainian attack on a Russian-flagged oil tanker.

feedItems.title: Metals Mixed as Weak Demand Meets Tight Supply
feedItems.description: Base metals were mixed, while gold prices fell in early London trade, with worries over demand keeping prices low, though tight supply likely providing a floor to prices.

feedItems.title: US Dollar Recovers From Friday's Falls But Gains Seen Limited Ahead of CPI Data
feedItems.description: The dollar recovered from falls on Friday following a below-forecast rise in non-farm payrolls, but gains will be limited as investors look ahead to key inflation data for July on Thursday, MUFG said.

author.name: Guillemette de Ventadour
author.description: A whimsical troubadour from Occitania, who cherishes the company of nature's gentle creatures. She often includes metaphors of goats, dogs, rabbits, and snails in her poetry. Her writing style is terse.

newsMedieval:
Alas! Siemens, the energy's might,
Its fortunes stumble, fall outright.
Loss doth mount, as fickle as a goat,
An eager snail's paced profit, we note.

In Germany, the gear wheels stall,
Industry's might begins to fall.
Rabbits retreat, demand does weaken,
A downturn, all too clear, doth quicken.

Yet, as yonder eastern sun ascends,
Indonesia's growth, it transcends.
Despite the snarl of world's rough play,
Like strong ox, it breaks the clay.

feedItems.title: Siemens Energy Lowers Full-Year Guidance
feedItems.description: Siemens Energy now expects a net loss of €4.5 billion, while profit margin before special items is seen between minus 10% and minus 8% for 2023, due to mounting challenges at Siemens Gamesa that will cost €2.2 billion.

feedItems.title: German Industrial Production Weakens More Than Expected
feedItems.description: Germany’s industrial output declined 1.5% in June, suggesting weak demand and adding to the likelihood of a slowdown in the eurozone economy ahead.

feedItems.title: Indonesia's Second-Quarter Growth Beat Expectations
feedItems.description: The Indonesian economy expanded more than expected in the second quarter, despite a global economic slowdown and declining prices for its leading export commodities.

author.name: Conchobar mac Dubhthach
author.description: An Irish bard of yore, who weaves dulcet melodies that capture hearts with tender love songs. With a quill dipped in courtly love, he pens metaphors of devotion, igniting the flames of passion in every soul who hears his verse.

newsMedieval:
From the East where dawn’s kiss paints the sky,
Afloat the Sensex, as eagles fly, 
In towers of tech and forge's fire,
Beds the hopes that earnings inspire.

Quiv'ring is the heart and wagon yoke, 
Midst Yellow's tale of humble folk,
Under debt's oppressive yoke they sway,
In shadows cast by pandemic's grey.

A prologue penned on Cyberspace's tome, 
Sees Musk prelude a familiar home,
To constellation X he trails his quill,
On undulant tides of the future, still.

feedItems.title: India's Sensex Edges Higher, Led by Industrial, Tech Stocks
feedItems.description: Indian shares were slightly higher, led by gains in industrial and technology stocks, as hopes for earnings growth continued and concerns about inflation eased.

feedItems.title: Yellow, One of the Largest U.S. Truckers, Files for Bankruptcy After Shutting Down
feedItems.description: The bankruptcy follows years of struggles as it tried to address the debt it accumulated through a series of mergers and a $700 million federal Covid-19 relief loan.

feedItems.title: From Twitter to X: Why Musk Is Resurrecting His Favorite Domain
feedItems.description: In late July, Elon Musk shifted Twitter’s name to X, a major change for the brand. But it’s not the first time the tech billionaire has used the URL x.com. WSJ explains what the site’s past could signal about its future.

author.name: Æthelred the Skald
author.description: A Norse poet who doth regale his audience with tales of gods and heroes, praising their might and prowess. He references Norse mythology and history in his poems. He is known for metaphors involving the sea and the weather and weaponry.

newsMedieval:
Æthelred doth speak of Kamyshin, brave and bold,
With forge aflame, in fervour stoked for battle fierce.
Like Thor, his hammer strikes, where iron meets anvil's hold,
The storm of war, against the Eastern wolf, he'd pierce.

In New Jersey's land, where pride, as Mead, doth flow,
The dwellers scorn to pump the Nectar of their steeds.
Like Skidbladnir's crew, their tasks, they well bestow,
Their custom hailed, in Odin's garden sows its seeds.

Brace thyself, O traveller, seeking Europe's gilded shore,
Delays await thee, as the Norns weave threads of strife.
Like storms at sea, troubles rise, 'fore summer's frothy roar,
Yet amidst the chaos, find the saga of life's fife.

feedItems.title: Ukraine's Ammunition Chief Battles to Boost Production
feedItems.description: Oleksandr Kamyshin, formerly the head of the state railway company, now faces the challenge of bringing Ukraine’s defense industry up to speed as the war with Russia drags on.

feedItems.title: New Jerseyans Don't Pump Gas. That's Just How They Like It.
feedItems.description: Many Garden State residents are proud to be the last U.S. state to prohibit self-service gas stations.

feedItems.title: Going to Europe This Summer? Brace for Flight Delays
feedItems.description: Wildfires, air-traffic control shortages, strikes and the war in Ukraine have led to more delays than last year’s summer of disruption.
